page.title: 13FRININGHAM FARM DETLING
page.content: The farm is run as a family concern by the farmer and his wife. One full time worker is employed but other labourers are employed, in season on a casual basis. The farm is a mixed farm, having sheep, cattle and poultry, together with crops, the main ones being wheat, barley and oilseed rape. Yields over the last 5 years:- Wheat - 3 tons per acre Barley - 2.5 tons per acre Rape Seed - 1.25 tons per acre Peas are also grown for freezing. Machinery includes a 4-wheel drive tractor, 100 H.P. worth Â£20000 and a combine harvester worth Â£45000. A good bullock could be sold at Â£1 per kilo (live weight) and there is a subsidy of 8p per kilo. A 4 month old lamb (dead weight 18 kilo) would be worth Â£35.
